title: The Good Dinosaur
summary: The Good Dinosaur is a 2015 American computer-animated adventure film[7] produced by Pixar Animation Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures. It was directed by Peter Sohn in his feature-length directorial debut (not counting the English translation of Ponyo) and was written by Meg LeFauve from an original idea by Bob Peterson, and stars the voices of Raymond Ochoa, Jack Bright, Steve Zahn, Sam Elliott, Anna Paquin, A. J. Buckley, Jeffrey Wright, and Frances McDormand. The film explores the alternate history where non-avian dinosaurs never became extinct, following a young, timid Apatosaurus named Arlo, who meets an unlikely human friend while traveling through a dangerous and mysterious landscape in order to return home.
